summary: Add sagemaker pipeline deployment to MLkit
description:
Value Statement: As a mlops engineer who builds tenant agnostic pipelines, I need to add a deployment module for sagemaker pipelines into mlkit so that the deployment workflow can be easily imported and extended

Acceptance Criteria - deployment module created in mlkit for sagemaker pipelines - mlkit CLI command aded to deploy sagemaker pipelines - tested with at least one real deployment

summary: User Testing, Validation, and Production Deployment
description:
Title: User Testing, Validation, and Production Deployment

Value Statement: As an Infrastructure Engineer, I want to onboard pilot users and deploy to production, so that we can validate the multi-user architecture and make the service available to all users.

A/C:
 - User documentation created (token acquisition, mcp.json configuration, troubleshooting) and 5-10 pilot users onboarded in sbxmgmt for testing
 - Multi-user validation complete: concurrent users don't interfere, each user sees only their accessible data, and Jira audit logs show actual usernames
 - Monitoring/alerting configured and user migration plan communicated

Points: 5

summary: Deploy Unified self-hosted Jira MCP
description:
Title: Deploy Unified Jira MCP

Value Statement: As an Infra Engineer, I want to deploy Unified self-hosted Jira MCP in sbxmgmt and mgmt to utilize a central-management k8s style MCP instead of local hosted MCP.

A/C:
 - Deploying the helm charts + template + values to sbxmgmt through ArgoCD
 - Testing and verifying the deployment is successful (pods running, ingress healthy, basic endpoints responding)
 - Making sure MCP server is set up in VS Code and able to communicate to Jira website by talking to the MCP Server through VS Code Github Copilot Chat

Points: 5

summary: Update Custom Logger Lambda for multi-tenant telemetry to create log groups
description:
Title: Update Custom Logger Lambda for multi-tenant telemetry to create log groups.

Value Statement: 
As a BIP-AI engineer who manages centralized logging for Bedrock services, I need the ability to update the router Lambda so that it creates a new group for new tenants and routes them correctly if the log group already exists. 

Acceptance Criteria:
- When platform logs are written to the central Bedrock log group, the custom Lambda filters log events by tenant and routes them to the correct tenant-specific log group.
- If the log group does not already exist, it will create a new log group for that tenant so that all their logs are centralized
- Verify that it is being sent to the tenant specific log group correctly.

summary: Create Langfuse Prototype (SBX) with Chart-Deployed Dependencies
description:
Title: Create Langfuse Prototype (SBX) with Chart-Deployed Dependencies 

###Value Statement
As an Infrastructure Engineer, I need to deploy Langfuse to the sbx-kubernetes cluster with all dependencies running in-cluster so I can validate the basic deployment and enable LLM tracing functionality.

###Acceptance Criteria
Langfuse is deployed in the bip-ai namespace on sbx cluster via ArgoCD
Users can sign up and log in via the web UI
Langfuse is accessible via internal ALB at langfuse-sbx.bip.va.gov
All chart-deployed dependencies are running: PostgreSQL, ClickHouse, Redis/Valkey, S3(MinIO)
Wrapper Helm chart created in bip-ai-infrastructure repo
Values files created in bip-ai-infrastructure-values repo for sbx

###Assumptions
The sbx-kubernetes cluster has sufficient capacity for all in-cluster dependencies
nginx controller is installed and configured
ArgoCD is configured and can deploy from the repos

###Dependencies
None

###Notes
Uses official Langfuse Helm chart v1.5.19 as dependency in wrapper chart
Chart-deployed PostgreSQL (Bitnami) for database
Chart-deployed ClickHouse (Bitnami) for analytics (stays in-cluster per requirements)
Chart-deployed Redis/Valkey (Bitnami) for caching (temporary - will migrate to ElastiCache)
Chart-deployed MinIO (Bitnami) for S3-compatible storage (temporary - will migrate to S3)
ZooKeeper deployed as part of ClickHouse subchart
Secrets: langfuse-secrets with salt and nextauth-secret keys must be created before deployment
Redis auth disabled for initial deployment (needs proper secret management)
Out of Scope
RDS integration (Ticket 2)
S3 integration (Ticket 3)
ElastiCache integration (Ticket 4)
Production-grade secret management
Monitoring and alerting
Load testing

summary: Infra: On Call Support
Fix failure alerting from Grafana to Slack for non-prod
Fix failure alerting from Grafana to Slack for prod
Fix StrandsHooks Deprecation Warnings
description:
Title: Fix StrandsHooks Deprecation Warnings 
Value Statement: As a platform engineer, I need StrandsBaseAgent to run Strands agents with LoggingHooks enabled without emitting DeprecationWarnings so that logs remain clean and we avoid future breakages if/when deprecated APIs are removed.

AC:
- No warning with LoggingHooks enabled
- Warnings fixed, not suppressed.
- Logging behavior remains functionally equivalent
- Add test that reproduces current DeprecationWarnings and asserts they do not occur after fix.

summary: Create example notebook for step function orchestration of Strands Agent
description:
Title: Create example notebook for step function orchestration of Strands Agent
Value Statement: As an MLOps engineer creating example agent deployment patterns, I want to add a notebook explaining how to create a step functions pattern with strands agents.

summary: Create architecture diagram and standard tagging convention for all BIP AI images
description:
Title: Create architecture diagram and standard tagging convention for all BIP AI images

Value Statement: As an MLOps engineer on the BIP AI team, I want to organize all the images that we maintain.

AC: 
1. Architecture Diagram

 Create a visual architecture diagram showing:
All internal BIP-AI images and their hierarchical relationships (base images → derived images)
ECR repository structure (261727212250.dkr.ecr.us-gov-west-1.amazonaws.com/mlmats/)
Image build pipeline flow (GitHub → Jenkins → ECR → SageMaker Domain)
Environment promotion path (dev → stage → preprod → prod)
 Diagram clearly distinguishes between:
Platform images (mlkit, lambda base, Python base)
Lambda function images (bedrock loggers, routers)
Future tenant image category placeholder

2. Document version tagging rules:

Release versions: X.Y.Z (e.g., 2.0.4)
Development versions: X.Y.Z.devN (e.g., 2.0.4.dev0)
Version must be synchronized across pyproject.toml, Dockerfile, metadata.yaml, and bipai_env_setup.sh

3. Process Documentation

 Document the image build and release process including:

Build triggers: When images are built (PR merge, release creation, manual trigger)
Version synchronization: List of files requiring version updates (pyproject.toml, Dockerfile, metadata.yaml, bipai_env_setup.sh)
Jenkins pipelines: Reference to MLKit Release and MLKit Deployment pipelines

 Document the Lambda image build process:

How Lambda Dockerfiles extend bip-ai-lambda-base-image
Lambda image naming convention

Title: Get more familiar w/ Grafana, identify metrics that can be split up by tenant, and start work on this

Notes: This should be more of a spike/research ticket

description:
Title: Consolidate the two BDA tutorial notebooks into one
Value Statement: As a MLE on the BIP AI team I need to conslidate the two BDA notebooks into one so tenants have a single reference point for BDA

Acceptance Criteria:
- Reviewed the differences between the boto3 based tutorial notebook in tenant resources and the mlkit based tutorial notebook
- Consolidated the two notebooks into one leveraging mlkit
- Ensured the bda logs are being written to the /aws/bedrock/modelinvocations: bedrock-data-automation-events log stream

summary: Improve UX of BedrockManager
description:
Title: Improve UX of BedrockManager

Value Statement: As a BIP AI MLOps engineer, I want to improve the user experience of the BedrockManager so tenants can use it more seamlessly

AC: 
Add method `get_inference_profile_by_model(model_name: str) -> dict | None`
  - Input: Model name substring (e.g., "claude-3-5-sonnet", "claude-3-haiku", "titan-express", "nova-pro")
  - Output: Dict with `{"inference_profile_arn": str, "foundation_model_arn": str, "description": str}` or `None` if not found
  - Should search tenant's inference profiles and match by model name in description or ARN
Add method `list_available_models() -> list[dict]`
  - Returns list of available models with their inference profile ARNs for the current tenant
  - Each item includes: `model_name`, `inference_profile_arn`, `foundation_model_arn`

- Add method `invoke_model(prompt: str, model_name: str = None, inference_profile_arn: str = None, **kwargs) -> str`
  - Either `model_name` or `inference_profile_arn` must be provided
  - If `model_name` provided, automatically look up the inference profile
  - Automatically builds correct request body based on model type (Claude, Titan, Nova, Llama)
  - Returns extracted text response (not raw response dict)
  - Supports optional kwargs: `max_tokens`, `temperature`, `system_prompt`
- Add method `invoke_model_with_full_response(prompt: str, model_name: str = None, inference_profile_arn: str = None, **kwargs) -> dict`
  - Same as above but returns full response including token usage
- Telemetry integration for new methods

- Add method `invoke_model_stream(prompt: str, model_name: str = None, inference_profile_arn: str = None, **kwargs) -> Generator[str, None, None]`
  - Yields text chunks as they arrive
  - Handles model-specific streaming response formats internally
  - Supports same parameters as `invoke_model`

- Add method `create_batch_job(input_s3_uri: str, output_s3_uri: str, model_id: str, job_name: str = None) -> dict`
  - Returns job ARN and initial status
  - Validates model supports batch inference
- Add method `get_batch_job_status(job_arn: str) -> dict`
  - Returns job status and progress
- Add method `list_batch_jobs(status: str = None) -> list[dict]`
  - Lists batch jobs with optional status filter
-  Add method `stop_batch_job(job_arn: str) -> bool`

Update Tenant Notebooks

summary: Implement preprod delegates in harness

Title: Implement preprod delegates in harness
As a Platform/DevOps engineer
I want to verify that preprod Harness delegates are healthy, correctly configured, and selectable by pipelines

Refine SPA-Agentic Harness trigger
description:
Value Statement: As a BIP AI Tenant, I want a Harness trigger that detects changes in Git (specific branch/file in the SPA-Agentic repo) and automatically runs our pipeline that builds the container image and deploys the Lambda function, so that deployments happen consistently and automatically whenever a change is merged/committed, reducing manual steps and ensuring environments stay in sync with Git 

AC: When a user makes a PR in a specific branch for a specific file in the the SPA Agentic Repo, the user has the ability to automatically kick off the tenant-agnostic pipeline in Harness (and have it succeed) w/ the SPA-Agentic lambda input set This can be verified in the execution history of the tenant-agnostic pipeline and of the trigger itself. Also will require going into the AWS Console to see if the lambda updates there 

Misc Note(s): Potential future work could include creating lambdas automatically and testing the lambda's functionality

summary: Migrate Langfuse PostgreSQL to AWS RDS
description: ###Value Statement As an Infrastructure Engineer, I need to migrate Langfuse from chart-deployed PostgreSQL to AWS RDS so we have a managed, scalable, and production-ready database with automated backups. ###Acceptance Criteria RDS PostgreSQL instance provisioned via Crossplane claim Langfuse successfully connects to RDS instance Chart-deployed PostgreSQL is disabled (postgresql.deploy: false) Database migrations run successfully against RDS Existing data migrated (if applicable) or fresh start confirmed Langfuse functionality verified after migration Assumptions Crossplane is configured with AWS provider Existing ai-rds-cluster composition can be used or adapted RDS instance can be accessed from sbx-kubernetes cluster (security groups configured) Dependencies Ticket 1 must be complete (Langfuse deployed and functional) ###Notes Use existing Crossplane RDS composition pattern from the team Configure connection details via values file (host, database name, credentials) May need to update Langfuse values for external PostgreSQL configuration Consider using Kubernetes secrets for database credentials ###Out of Scope Database performance tuning (can be follow-up) Multi-AZ configuration (depends on requirements) Read replicas

summary: Enable Claude Sonnet 4.5 integration across all environments to provide enhanced AI capabilities
description:
Title: Enable Claude Sonnet 4.5 integration across all environments to provide enhanced AI capabilities.

Value Statement

As a development team member and end user who interacts with AI-powered features and services, I need the ability to access and utilize Claude Sonnet 4.5 model capabilities consistently across Development, Staging, and Production environments so that I can leverage improved AI performance, enhanced reasoning capabilities, and ensure consistent user experiences across all deployment stages.

Acceptance Criteria
 * When a user makes requests to Bedrock in any environment (Dev, Staging, Production), the user has the ability to receive responses generated by Claude Sonnet 4.5 with improved performance and capabilities compared to previous model versions.
 * Verify that tagging works for cost tracking
 * Create the new Inference Profiles for all environment and test they work Dependencies This Story is dependent on the completion of VAEC ticket to add Claude 4.5 to our accounts
